g.text: That main network is carved into 4 x
where the first subnet is managed by NSX with
native distributed routing, mostly for the management components, and then 3
remaining other subnets are available, through static routing and guest vlans (tagging
within your nested environment, and encapsulated into the Geneve VNI of your assigned
It also provides you the flexibility to create your own VLANs & networks within your
nested environment as if you were in control of your virtual TORs.
That said the routing of other subnets will not be advertised back to the parent lab T0 to
avoid any duplicate/overlapping/routes or other fancy disasters to happen...
